channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Westminster double murder: Man, 49, charged
item.description: Sharon Pickles and Clinton Ashmore were both fatally stabbed in north-west London.

item.title: Afghanistan: Pen Farthing has 'mixed emotions' after landing in UK
item.description: The former Royal Marine says he has "true deep feeling of sadness for Afghan today".

item.title: Fudstock festival: Three injured in Barrow fairground ride incident
item.description: One woman is in a critical condition in hospital and two others were seriously hurt.

item.title: Afghan refugee heading to UK gives birth at 30,000 feet
item.description: Soman Noori gives birth to baby girl Havva while flying to Birmingham, with no doctor on board.

item.title: A3 death: Man charged with Helen Anderson's murder
item.description: Helen Anderson's body was found in undergrowth beside a slip road on the A3 in Guildford.

item.title: Staffordshire Covid sceptic Marcus Birks dies in hospital
item.description: Marcus Birks, 40, went on to urge other people to get the Covid vaccine after he was hospitalised.

item.title: How lockdown puppies led to the rise of doggy day care
item.description: As owners return to the office or seek to socialise their pups, day care for dogs is taking off.

item.title: Moped rider's rude name place tour finishes in Bell End
item.description: Paul Taylor made the charity fundraising trip in memory of a friend who died of cancer.

item.title: Great Yarmouth rollercoaster return for golden wedding couple
item.description: A couple married for 50 years recreate their honeymoon memories with a rollercoaster celebration.

item.title: Dark Cloud: The last known Chippewa 'Sixties Scoop' survivor
item.description: Dark Cloud shares his story after more unmarked graves were found in Canada in June.

item.title: Kettering: Police not seeking anyone else over deaths
item.description: A man and a woman were found dead at a property in Kettering on Friday afternoon.

item.title: Reading festival: Woman, 20, dies in hospital
item.description: Festival Republic said the 20-year-old had a pre-existing condition and died on Friday evening.

item.title: Decades of hoarding made house 'a no-go area'
item.description: A woman who struggled with buying and hoarding "bargains" for 30 years explains how it began.

item.title: Afghanistan events 'raw and emotional' for veterans
item.description: Military veteran Nick Wilson says the current Afghanistan crisis is affecting those who fought there.

item.title: Manchester Pride exhibition to reveal stories of freedom
item.description: The audio recordings and portraits form part of a weekend of cultural events to celebrate Pride.

item.title: Drone footage reveals scale of Leamington Spa fire
item.description: Flame and thick, dark smoke fills the sky above Leamington Spa.

item.title: Devon stroke victim inspired to get back on his feet
item.description: Chas Connal was inspired to walk again thanks to a bright idea from his stepdaughter.

item.title: Manchester Pride: Protest held over festival management
item.description: Organisers say they will review activities following concerns about the event's management.

item.title: Acorns Hospice: Charity duo cycle to all Premier League grounds
item.description: Chris Scott and Shaun Spence cover 850 miles in eight days in aid of a children's hospice.

item.title: Covid: Vaccine passports 'to boost illegal outdoor raves'
item.description: An organiser of the events says Covid jab scepticism will draw people to so-called "free parties".

item.title: UK's oldest living heart transplant patient marks 90th birthday
item.description: Ted Warner was only expected to live for eight more years after his operation in 1990.

item.title: Red Arrows pilot's widow completes Peaks challenge
item.description: Emma Egging finished the 20-mile Edale challenge after the 10th anniversary of her husband's death.

item.title: No. 2 to Kettering: School bus memory inspires Disney film
item.description: Liza Rhea says a smile from a stranger when she was a child had a profound effect on her.

item.title: Tottenham Hotspur 1-0 Watford: Son Heung-min winner maintains Spurs' 100% start
item.description: Son Heung-min marks his 200th Premier League appearance with the winning goal as Tottenham maintain their 100% start to the season against Watford.

item.title: Burnley 1-1 Leeds United: Patrick Bamford earns visitors a point at Turf Moor
item.description: Patrick Bamford caps a dream week with a late equaliser as Leeds extend Burnley's winless home run to 12 games with a draw at Turf Moor.

item.title: England v India: Jos Buttler to miss fourth Test at Kia Oval
item.description: Jonny Bairstow will keep wicket for England at the Kia Oval as Jos Buttler awaits the birth of his second child.
